Yes, Delta Air Lines conducts background checks on their employees as part of their security protocol. Before hiring an employee, Delta Air Lines typically performs a pre-employment background check that can include criminal, employment, and education history. The airline also conducts ongoing background checks for employees who hold certain positions, such as pilots or employees with access to secure areas. 

Delta Air Lines' background check process complies with all applicable laws, regulations and industry standards, including those set forth by relevant government agencies. The airline also has a strict policy of not hiring individuals who have been convicted of certain crimes or who have engaged in certain types of misconduct. This policy is in place to protect the safety of passengers, employees and the public at large.
